posts.post_content: This won me two games at the prerelease today. Posted By: Shallowend (1/5/2012 6:43:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Casting it once is decent. If you have two unblocked creatures, that's 3 mana for 4 extra damage, which isn't bad. The fact that you can cast it, let it hit your graveyard, and then cast it again and have 2 unblocked creatures deal an extra 8 damage for 6 mana is a game winning move. Or, you can flash back it at a later, more convenient time if you want, which is fine.  
  
Of course, it scales pretty crazily with additional creatures. With 4 unblocked 1/1s, casting it twice in the same turn is a solid 20 damage.  
  
Of course, I'm forgetting all those wonderful first striking and double striking red and white creatures which will likely make this a nightmare card for opponents.  
  
I'm looking forward to using this in EDH. Looking weak and then explosively ending the game is my favorite way to play, and all those 0/1 [kher keep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=kher keep) kobolds and [springjack pasture](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=springjack pasture) goats that litter my side of the field will get their chance to shine.
posts.html:
Casting it once is decent. If you have two unblocked creatures, that's 3 mana for 4 extra damage, which isn't bad. The fact that you can cast it, let it hit your graveyard, and then cast it again and have 2 unblocked creatures deal an extra 8 damage for 6 mana is a game winning move. Or, you can flash back it at a later, more convenient time if you want, which is fine.

Of course, it scales pretty crazily with additional creatures. With 4 unblocked 1/1s, casting it twice in the same turn is a solid 20 damage.

Of course, I'm forgetting all those wonderful first striking and double striking red and white creatures which will likely make this a nightmare card for opponents.

I'm looking forward to using this in EDH. Looking weak and then explosively ending the game is my favorite way to play, and all those 0/1 kher keep kobolds and springjack pasture goats that litter my side of the field will get their chance to shine.

posts.post_content: I heard this was good in limited, so I switched from red/blue to red white when I saw this in the draft. It was the kill card for 4 of my victories on the way to winning the draft, and it also provided brutal combat tricks since I had 4 cards with first strike in the deck. If I had realized how crazy this would be with first strike, I would have drafted more. As it was, I let a [Voiceless Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voiceless Spirit) and a [Kessig Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf) pass me by.
posts.html:
I heard this was good in limited, so I switched from red/blue to red white when I saw this in the draft. It was the kill card for 4 of my victories on the way to winning the draft, and it also provided brutal combat tricks since I had 4 cards with first strike in the deck. If I had realized how crazy this would be with first strike, I would have drafted more. As it was, I let a Voiceless Spirit and a Kessig Wolf pass me by.
